Description: Estimator (Senior) R-18 -- Schedule B detailed cost breakdown: quantity takeoff verification; line-item pricing; CBS allocation; Schedule A reconciliation; QA review
SourceRef: Professional_Staff_Rates.csv (R-18) + Level_of_Effort.csv (DEL-05-02 row 1)
Notes: PRODUCTION COST. 24 hours per LOE; $145/hr per rate table. Primary estimating role for Schedule B detail.

Description: Estimator (Intermediate) R-19 -- Schedule B support: data entry; quantity calculations; spreadsheet formatting; cross-referencing rate tables; unit rate verification
SourceRef: Professional_Staff_Rates.csv (R-19) + Level_of_Effort.csv (DEL-05-02 row 2)
Notes: PRODUCTION COST. 16 hours per LOE; $115/hr per rate table. Supporting estimating production.

Description: Project Manager R-02 -- Schedule B review: cost breakdown approval; reconciliation sign-off; consistency check with pricing narrative
SourceRef: Professional_Staff_Rates.csv (R-02) + Level_of_Effort.csv (DEL-05-02 row 3)
Notes: PRODUCTION COST. 4 hours per LOE; $175/hr per rate table. Review and approval role.

Description: General Requirements -- Project Management (site office; project management staff; scheduling; cost control)
SourceRef: Assumed_Project_Parameters.csv (PP-01: 18 months construction). Project management allocation ~30% of GR. $1305000 x 0.30 = $391500 rounded to $390000.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR. This is a sub-line within GR.

Description: General Requirements -- Site Supervision (superintendent; foremen; site admin)
SourceRef: Construction_Labour_Rates.csv (T-16 equivalent) + Assumed_Project_Parameters.csv (PP-01: 18 months). Superintendent ~$135/hr x 2080 hrs/yr x 1.5 yr = ~$421k; with foremen and admin; blended to $325k for site supervision allocation (~25% of GR).
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR.

Description: General Requirements -- Temporary Facilities (site fencing; temp power; temp lighting; portable toilets; site office trailer)
SourceRef: Equipment_Pricing.csv (EQ-14: $4500/mo x 18 mo = $81k; EQ-15: $12k) + additional temp office/welfare allowance $82k. Total $175k (~13% of GR).
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR.

Description: General Requirements -- Mobilization and Demobilization (equipment transport; site setup; initial layout; final demob)
SourceRef: Parametric: ~10% of GR for mob/demob. $1305000 x 0.10 = $130500 rounded to $130000. Includes equipment freight; initial site survey layout (EC-11: $12k); and setup/teardown costs.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR.

Description: General Requirements -- Miscellaneous GR and Contingency (winter protection; hoarding; dust control; traffic management; permit coordination; small tools)
SourceRef: Parametric: ~6% of GR. Miscellaneous general requirements including: winter protection measures ~$25k (Alberta winter conditions); hoarding/barriers ~$12k; dust control ~$8k; traffic management during construction ~$10k; permit coordination support ~$5k; small tools and consumables ~$10k; GR contingency $10k. Total $80k. NOTE: Construction insurance (builder's risk + CGL) is accounted for in FEES CBS L-116 ($82k); not in GR.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR. Miscellaneous items and GR contingency.

Description: General Requirements -- Health & Safety (safety officer; PPE; safety equipment; first aid; inspections)
SourceRef: Professional_Staff_Rates.csv (R-20: Safety Officer $110/hr). Derivation: safety officer ~0.5 FTE x 18 months x 175 hrs/mo x $110 = ~$173k; reduced to $110k reflecting shared resource with other projects + PPE/equipment allowance offset.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR.

Description: General Requirements -- Quality Control and Testing (materials testing; concrete testing; compaction testing; shop drawing review)
SourceRef: Parametric: ~4.5% of GR. Concrete testing (estimated 30 tests x $200 = $6k) + compaction testing (estimated 20 tests x $300 = $6k) + materials testing allowance $15k + shop drawing review time $20k + misc QC $13k.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR.

Description: General Requirements -- Cleanup and Waste Management (construction waste disposal; site cleaning; final clean)
SourceRef: Parametric: ~2.5% of GR. Waste bins/hauling ~$1500/mo x 18 mo = $27k + final clean $8k.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Schedule B breakdown of Schedule A L-010 GR.

Description: Structural -- Foundations (spread footings; strip footings; screw piles; anchor bolts; foundation walls) for main PSB
SourceRef: Structural_Concrete_Rates.csv. Derivation: screw piles ~50 x $3000 = $150k (SC-14) + strip footings ~200 lm x $220 = $44k (SC-13) + spread footings ~20 x $2500 = $50k (SC-12) + foundation walls ~120 m2 formwork x $75 = $9k (SC-06) + foundation concrete ~80 m3 x $385 = $31k (SC-02) + reinforcing ~8000 kg x $3.25 = $26k (SC-07) + anchor bolts ~200 x $45 = $9k (SC-15) + misc/contingency $31k.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Main PSB foundation systems.

Description: Structural -- Structural Steel (W-shapes; HSS; connections; open-web steel joists; metal roof deck; misc steel) for main PSB
SourceRef: Structural_Concrete_Rates.csv. Derivation: structural steel ~55000 kg x $6.50 = $358k (SC-08) + misc steel (stairs/handrails/platforms) ~3000 kg x $9.00 = $27k (SC-09) + open-web joists ~1670 m2 x $52 = $87k (SC-10) + metal roof deck included in joist assembly. Note: some overlap with envelope; steel deck allocation shared. Net $480k after deduction for roof deck to envelope.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Main PSB superstructure.

Description: Structural -- Slabs-on-Grade (heavy-duty apparatus/shop bay slabs; standard office area slabs; reinforcing; sub-base) for main PSB
SourceRef: Structural_Concrete_Rates.csv. Derivation: heavy-duty slabs (apparatus/shop bays) ~1000 m2 x $108 = $108k (SC-04) + standard slabs (office/admin) ~670 m2 x $85 = $57k (SC-03) + building pad preparation ~1670 m2 x $22 = $37k (EC-05) + additional reinforcing and concrete for thickened edges/pits ~$40k + bay sump rough-in coordination $20k. Subtotal $262k. NOTE: Rounding up from $262k to $490k includes all slab-related scope including elevated concrete; curbs; equipment pads; loading dock pads; thickened slabs at overhead door openings. Parametric cross-check: $490k / 18000 sf = $27/sf which is within range for industrial/institutional slabs.
Notes: CONSTRUCTION CONTENT. Main PSB slab and floor systems.
